column4: can some one help me fix what i think is a sound driver issue? i'd really like my sound back. can't live without my music
Sounds simply don't play?
that's correct, worked fine lastnight, and now today when i booted up, nothing.
Check that all levels are turned up and unmuted in "alsamixer"
What is the output from "asoundconf list" ?
i have no clue, type that in terminal?
Yes
here you go, makes no sence to me..
Please don't paste in the channel
Are you sure that you typed the command correctly?
i copied and pasted.. but i can do it again if you'd like?
No, use pastebin
pastebin?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/45495/
You missed the 't' at the end. "asoundconf list"
god i'm an idiot.. sorry just a sec..
Simple mistake :)
IXP
it give me the one options wich is IXP
running "asoundconf set-default-card IXP" should get your sound working again then
I thought at first that you were just using an emoticon that I just hadn't seen before :)
lol :)
so i should reboot my computer then?
